intro: Burretiodendron combretoides, commonly known as the African flame tree, is a deciduous tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Lythraceae and is characterized by its showy, fiery orange-red flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has smooth, greyish bark and lance-shaped leaves that are opposite in arrangement. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular ornamental species in warmer climates.
